trans-unit.source: Represents an individual row in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
The GridViewRow class is used represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has a designated row type using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration.
The following table lists the different row types.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataRow`|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`EmptyDataRow`|The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

The empty row is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control has no records to display and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.EmptyDataTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template is not `null`.| |`Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Separator`|A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| To determine the row type of a GridViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property.
A GridViewRow object also has a state associated with it.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.

|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`Alternate`|The GridViewRow object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`Edit`|The GridViewRow object is in edit mode.| |`Normal`|The GridViewRow object is in its normal (default) state.| |`Selected`|The GridViewRow object is selected.| To determine the state of a GridViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection.
To determine the index of a GridViewRow object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property.
You can access the properties of the underlying data object that is bound to the GridViewRow object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property.

> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> property is available only during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
To determine the index of the data object in the underlying data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the GridViewRow object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property.
If a cell contains other controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> specified.

To retrieve a field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> field column or an automatically generated field column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of the cell.

To retrieve a field value from other field column types where the field value is bound to a control, first retrieve the control from the appropriate cell and then access the appropriate property of the control.
> [!NOTE] > It is possible to use a data-binding expression directly in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column without binding the value to a property of a control.
In this case, the field value is automatically placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control.

To retrieve the field value, you must first retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control from the appropriate cell and then use its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of GridViewRow, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex%2A>|The value of the `dataItemIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex%2A>|The value of the `rowIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowState%2A>|The value of the `rowState` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A>|The value of the `rowType` parameter.|

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows*> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
The index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem*> in the underlying <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> enumeration values.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the underlying data object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object is bound.
Use the DataItem property to access the properties of the underlying data object to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is bound.
The DataItem property is only available during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.RowDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the underlying data object to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object is bound.
Gets the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem*> in the underlying <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
Use the DataItemIndex property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem%2A> in the underlying <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.
The index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem*> in the underlying data source.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event has been canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets the index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows*> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.

Use the RowIndex property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows*> collection of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowType%2A> property to determine the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object.

The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table: |Status value|Description| |------------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Alternate`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object is selected.| This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> values.
Gets the row type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the RowType property to determine the type of row that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object represents.
The following table lists the different row type values using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType> enumeration.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The empty row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.

The empty row is displayed when <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control does not have any records to display.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|A separator row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.| This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> values.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItem*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItem*>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DataItemIndex*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.DataItemIndex*>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer.DisplayIndex*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer> interface.
Returns <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow.RowIndex*>.
